summary: This is an email chain from October 2021 between U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) attorney Keturah Carr and other parties, discussing a Touhy request and subpoena related to the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence involves scheduling a call and sharing a protective order, indicating CBP's involvement in providing documents to the defense.

persons.name: Keturah Carr
persons.role: Senior Attorney, Office of the Associate Chief Counsel, New York, U.S. Customs and Border Protection
persons.context: CBP attorney corresponding about a Touhy request and subpoena in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, coordinating a call with other attorneys.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Identified as the sender of the subpoena request to CBP in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).

connections.description: Everdell is identified as defense counsel making a Touhy request/subpoena on behalf of Maxwell.
Carr, as CBP counsel, is responding to a subpoena request from defense attorney Everdell.

events.title: Email exchange regarding Touhy request
events.description: Email chain discussing coordination for a call about a Touhy request and subpoena from the defense in the Maxwell case, with a protective order attached.

locations: One World Trade Center, 50th Floor Suite 50.100, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) was involved in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, receiving a Touhy request/subpoena from defense attorney Christian Everdell.
A protective order related to the case was shared in the correspondence on October 29, 2021.
The communication highlights the procedural steps and inter-agency coordination (CBP counsel with other AUSAs) in responding to defense requests for information.
